Event.0: Actress Amber Heard (30) files for divorce from fellow actor Johnny Depp (52)
Event.1: American mathematician John Nash, who won the 1994 Nobel Prize for Economics for his landmark work on game theory and who struggled with paranoid schizophrenia, died at age 86.
Event.2: American rapper Eminem released The Marshall Mathers LP, which became the fastest-selling album in the history of rap.
Event.3: Eminem releases 3rd studio album "The Marshall Mathers LP", is fastest ever selling studio album (Grammy - Best Rap Album 2001)
Event.4: The Good Friday Agreement is accepted in a referendum in Northern Ireland with 75% voting yes.
Event.5: Horror film "The Shining" released directed by Stanley Kubrick, starring Jack Nicholson and Shelley Duvall, based on book by Stephen King
Event.6:
George Osborne
British politician
was born
Event.7: US Secretary of State John Kerry (26) weds heiress Julia Stimson Thorne (25)
Event.8: Mao Zedong starts the "Great Leap Forward" movement in China
Event.9: John F. Kennedy's sister Eunice Kennedy (31) weds activist and attorney Sargent Shriver at Saint Patrick's Cathedral in New York City
Event.10:
Tibet annexed by China
China formally annexed Tibet as an autonomous region on this day in 1951, giving rise to a Tibetan independence movement—led by the Dalai Lama, winner of the 1989 Nobel Peace Prize—that continued into the early 21st century.
Event.11: Federal Republic of [West] Germany created out of the American, British and French occupation zones
Event.12: Comic book artist Jack Kirby (24) weds Roz Goldstein
Event.13: First wife Marguerite Van Kessel divorces NFL player Curly Lambeau (36) after 14 years of marriage
Event.14: Bonnie and Clyde, notorious American outlaws, were killed in a police shoot-out near Gibsland, Louisiana.
Event.15:
Joan Collins
English actress
was born
Event.16:
Rosemary Clooney
American actress and musician
was born
Event.17: Italy declared war on Austria-Hungary, entering World War I on the side of the Allies.
Event.18:
John Payne
American actor
was born
Event.19:
Douglas Fairbanks
American actor
was born
Event.20: 1st Preakness Stakes: G. Barbee aboard Survivor wins in 2:43 at Pimlico Race Course, Baltimore, Maryland
Event.21: South American independence leader Simón Bolívar enters Mérida, leading the invasion of Venezuela, and is proclaimed El Libertador ("The Liberator")
Event.22: Benjamin Franklin announces his invention of bifocals
Event.23: Swedish botanist and explorer Carolus Linnaeus, the first to frame principles for defining genera and species of organisms and to create a uniform system for naming them, was born in Råshult.
Event.24: Allied (Anglo-Dutch) forces led by the duke of Marlborough recorded a major victory over the French at the Battle of Ramillies, a turning point in the War of the Spanish Succession.
Event.25: The Defenestration of Prague occurred in response to religious persecution, helping set the stage for the Thirty Years' War.
Event.26: Second Defenestration of Prague: Two Catholic Lords Regent and their secretary are thrown out of a window and amazingly are not seriously injured by the 70 foot (21m) fall. Triggers the Thirty Years' War.
Event.27: King Henry VIII of England & Catherine of Aragon's marriage declared null & void by authority English clergy not the Pope
Event.28: Joan of Arc was captured by Burgundians near Compiègne, France.
